articles.author: Alexander Cornwell, Parisa Hafezi, Jeff Mason
articles.description: Before leaving for the world leaders summit, U.S. President Donald Trump said, "I hope there's going to be a deal."
articles.title: Israel-Iran battle escalates, will be high on agenda as world leaders meet

articles.author: Nathan Layne, Tom Polansek
articles.description: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz said a 57-year-old suspect was arrested on Sunday in the killing of a Democratic state lawmaker and her husband while posing as a police officer.
articles.title: U.S. police arrest suspect in Minnesota lawmakers' shooting

articles.author: John Irish, David Ljunggren
articles.description: Group of Seven leaders gather in the Canadian Rockies starting on Sunday amid growing splits with the United States over foreign policy and trade, with host Canada striving to avoid clashes with President Donald Trump.
articles.title: G7 leaders meet in Canada hoping to avoid Trump clash

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran has vowed to "open the gates of hell" in retaliation.
articles.title: Iran rejects ceasefire negotiations while under Israeli attack, official says

articles.author: John Irish
articles.description: More pressure must be exerted on Russia to secure a ceasefire in Ukraine, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said on Sunday, and urged the G7 nations to ramp up sanctions to achieve that goal.
articles.title: G7 needs to raise pressure on Russia, von der Leyen says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran does not intend to develop nuclear weapons but will pursue its right to nuclear energy and research, President Masoud Pezeshkian said on Monday, reiterating Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei's religious edict against weapons of mass destruction.
articles.title: Iranian president says Tehran does not seek nuclear weapons

articles.author: Promit Mukherjee
articles.description: Canada and the United Kingdom agreed on Sunday to set up a trade working group which will submit its recommendations to the prime ministers of the respective countries within the next six months, a joint statement by the two governments said.
articles.title: Canada, UK agree to establish trade working group, expand defense collaboration

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: Increasing the number of nuclear powered submarines operated by Australia, Britain and the United States will make the Indo Pacific more secure and was in the United States' interests, Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said on Monday.
articles.title: Australia's Albanese says he will press AUKUS, Indo Pacific security in Trump meeting

articles.author: Jeff Mason
articles.description: President Donald Trump said on Sunday that he hopes Israel and Iran can broker a deal but said sometimes countries have to fight it out first.
articles.title: Trump says he hopes Israel and Iran can strike deal

articles.author: Alasdair Pal
articles.description: An Australian woman accused of murder engaged in a calculated deception to kill three elderly relatives of her estranged husband with a meal she allegedly laced with toxic mushrooms, a court heard on Monday, as closing arguments in the trial began.
articles.title: Australian accused of mushroom murders engaged in 'sinister deception', court hears
